conbody.p: Information governance is about controlling an organizationâ€™s data. The data may be sensitive; or perhaps it is important that the data be absolutely accurate; or perhaps the organization must achieve legislative and compliance targets. Data governance includes the process and policies around the protection, curation, and access to data and encompasses all of privacy protection, data security, and data audit.

enforces governance policies for privacy and security within the data warehouse, rather than at the application layer. In-system governance ensures that data custodians, not application developers, retain control over privacy and security. Managing privacy and security within the data store also simplifies application development and the use of analytics tools.

Your governance policies will drive how you configure . Therefore, before configuring , you should make sure you have your organization's governance policy available to you.
